show.title: The Wake Up Call

title: The Looming Retirement Disaster
content:
Americans have simply not saved enough for retirement. Pensions are woefully underfunded. Municipalities are hurtling towards bankruptcy.
Social security is both underfunded and utterly inadequate for survival.
Plenty of statistics to digest here.
Young people already saddled with mountains of debt cannot even begin to save for their own retirement yet they must finance the retirement of the current retirees.
Meanwhile, food-stamp usage is hitting new all-time records.
Bernanke’s decision to continue flooding the system with useless money.
David Stockman’s pithy comments.
Automation hits the restaurant business.
Mass unemployment foreseen among waiters and waitresses.
Comparing the work ethic of ants and humans.
How ants use randomness creatively and how humans…don’t!
SEC ‘special exemptions’ and how they contributed to the crisis.
Europe’s debt at a record high.
Timing of the melt-down.
Exponential events versus linear ones.
Median household income has been falling sharply for several years.
The fiscal crisis in Chicago dwarfs that of Detroit.
Jim Kunstler on the consequences of the Fed’s abusive actions.
